children.value: class provides easy interface to perform Transform Feedback operations on given data. Applications can use this class to move data processing from CPU to GPU, where multiple parallel execution units will be used for processing. Data is handled in form of
objects, i.e. data resides in the GPU memory. Output of this class can directly set as attributes on
for regular rendering operations, CPU access is not required hence avoids expensive CPU and GPU sync.
This class is only supported when using

properties.ariaLabel: use case  reading source data from texture object experimental permalink

children.value: Use case : Reading source data from texture object (Experimental)

In addition to reading data from Buffer objects, Transform can read from texture objects. Transform allows to access texture data in the same way as buffer data and internally generates required texture co-ordinates and sample instructions.
// simple shader that adds data from a buffer and texture to generate new buffer.
// specify source texture object using input attribute name
// resulting buffer contains sum of input buffer and texture data.

properties.ariaLabel: use case  generating a texture object experimental permalink

children.value: Use case : Generating a texture object (Experimental)
In addition to reading data from a texture object, Transform can generate texture object, by rendering data into it offline. Source data can be either buffer(s), texture(s) or any combination.

object or buffer params object. If a buffer params object is specified, it will contain following fields, these can be used to capture data into the buffer a particular offset and size.
=(Number, default: 0) - Byte offset that is used to start recording the data in the buffer.
=(Number, default: remaining buffer size) - Size in bytes that is used for recording the data.

Returns current destination buffer corresponding to given varying name.
Reads and returns data from current destination buffer corresponding to the given varying name. When no 'varyingName' is provided, it reads and returns data from current target texture.

, Optional) - when specified, first checks if there is a corresponding feedback buffer, if so reads data from this buffer and returns. When not specified, there must be target texture and data is read from this texture and returned.

(Boolean, Optional, Default: false) - applicable only when reading data from target texture, when true, data is packed to the actual size varyings. When false return array contains 4 values (R, G, B and A) for each element. Un-used element value will be 0 for R, G and B and 1 for A channel.
